marketNews.title: BMRI 5M25: Net Profit Flat YoY
marketNews.content:
Bank Mandiri (BMRI) recorded net profit for the bank only segment of 4.5 trillion rupiah in May 2025 (-2% YoY, +26% MoM). This result brought the net profit for 5M25 to 19.7 trillion rupiah (+0% YoY), relatively in line with consensus expectations which project consolidated net profit for 2025F to be flat (+0.3%) YoY. On a monthly basis, BMRI's performance increased in May 2025 post-Eid al-Fitr. The realization of the company's performance for 5M25 - which generally tends to resemble 1Q25 performance - indicates that the performance trend in 2Q25 will not be much different from 1Q25, unless there is a significant change in performance in June 2025.

Revenue More Supported by Non-II Than NII

Non-Interest Income (Non-II) grew +6% YoY in May 2025, leading Non-II to increase +13% YoY during 5M25. Meanwhile, Net Interest Income (NII) slightly decreased by -1% YoY in May 2025, and only grew +4% YoY during 5M25.

The low NII performance is primarily caused by a significant increase in interest expense amidst tight liquidity conditions. This is reflected in the Net Interest Margin (NIM) which remained low in May 2025 at 4.39%, resulting in the NIM for 5M25 standing at 4.45% (vs. 5M24: 4.86%; 1Q25: 4.46%). The NIM for 5M25 is relatively lower compared to the 2025 guidance from management (after adjusting bank only vs. consolidated).

Compared to 1Q25, the annual growth of Non-II and NII during 5M25 is not significantly different. During 1Q25, Non-II and NII grew by +15% YoY and +6% YoY, respectively.

PPOP Flat Due to Increase in Opex

Opex increased +6% YoY in May 2025, so opex during 5M25 rose +22% YoY. This increase offset income growth, causing Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) to tend to be flat (-1% YoY) both in May 2025 and during 5M25.

Provision expense rose +7% YoY in May 2025, but was still down -6% YoY during 5M25. This decrease in provision expense is reflected in a lower Cost of Credit (CoC), at 0.7% during 5M25 (vs. 5M24: 0.87%), which is relatively lower compared to the 2025 guidance from management (after adjusting bank only vs. consolidated).

Key Takeaway

We assess that liquidity remains the main challenge, so easing liquidity has the potential to be a positive catalyst for BMRI. In expectation terms, performance pressure has - at least partially - been anticipated by the market, where consensus has reduced consolidated net profit estimates for 2025F by -3%/-9% in the last 3/6 months. As of Wednesday (25/6), BMRI is trading at a valuation of 1.46x 1-Year Forward P/BV, nearly touching -1 Standard Deviation (1.42x) below the 5-year historical average. At this level, we see BMRI offering a minimum dividend yield potential of ~7%.

marketNews.title: China and India Shift to Higher-Grade Coal, Cutting Indonesian Imports
marketNews.content: Reuters reports that China and India - which are major global coal importers - are cutting thermal coal imports from Indonesia and preferring higher-calorie coal from other countries because the decline in global coal prices makes high-quality coal more competitive. The director of coal trading company I-Energy Natural Resources, Vasudev Pamnani, stated that high-calorie coal can generate more energy per US dollar paid even if the price per ton is more expensive. Pamnani estimated that 1 million tons of high-calorie coal can replace 1.2-1.5 million tons of coal from Indonesia. Meanwhile, an analyst from commodity analysis firm Kpler, Zhiyuan Li, stated that medium and low-calorie thermal coal from Indonesia is currently competing with supplies from Russia, which are being discounted at the same value. Kpler noted that Indonesian thermal coal export volume during 5M25 fell -12% YoY to 187 million tons.

marketNews.title: The Indonesian Government Plans to Require E-commerce Platforms to Collect Sales Tax from Sellers
marketNews.content: Reuters reports that the Indonesian government plans to implement new regulations requiring e-commerce platforms to collect income tax from their sellers, with the tax rate imposed reaching 0.5% of the seller's sales revenue for sellers whose annual turnover is between 500 million rupiah and 4.8 billion rupiah. Reuters sources stated that this step is aimed at boosting state revenue which is currently weakening, and as an effort to equalize the position of online stores with physical stores. Reuters sources also said that the regulation could be announced as early as next month, but e-commerce platforms oppose this regulation. The Ministry of Finance declined to comment on this Reuters report, while the Indonesian E-Commerce Association (idEA) neither confirmed nor denied the news.

marketNews.title: Finance Minister Sri Mulyani: Indonesia On Track to Keep Modest Budget Deficit
marketNews.content: Finance Minister, Sri Mulyani, stated that the government is committed to fiscal discipline while implementing President Prabowo Subianto's priority programs. Sri Mulyani estimates the 2025 State Budget deficit will reach 2.5% of GDP as targeted, and mentioned that the government plans to provide additional policies to stimulate consumption, investment, and trade in order to meet the economic growth target of +5.2% YoY this year.

marketNews.title: Manpower Minister Yassierli: Wage Subsidy (BSU) Has Only Reached 14% of Target Recipients as of June 24, 2025
marketNews.content: Manpower Minister, Yassierli, stated that as of June 24, 2025, wage subsidy assistance (BSU) has only been distributed to 2.45 million workers or approximately 14% of the total target recipients. Yassierli explained that the low realization of BSU recipients is due to the distribution process requiring several stages, including data verification and validation. The government targets the BSU program to reach 17.3 million workers with salaries below 3.5 million rupiah per month or according to provincial minimum wage. BSU is provided at 300 thousand rupiah per month for the June and July 2025 periods.

marketNews.title: PLN Recorded Electricity Sales Growth of 6.17% YoY in 2024; Pertamina Patra Niaga Recorded BBM Sales Growth of 5.6% YoY in 2024
marketNews.content: PT PLN recorded electricity sales growth of +6.17% YoY during 2024 reaching 17.78 TWh. Meanwhile, PT Pertamina Patra Niaga recorded fuel oil (BBM) sales in retail, corporate, and subsidiary segments grew +5.6% YoY during 2024 to 105 million kiloliters.

marketNews.title: Indoritel Makmur Internasional's CEO Discusses Indomaret IPO Opportunity
marketNews.content: The Director of Indoritel Makmur Internasional (DNET), Haliman Kustedjo, stated that they have long considered taking PT Indomarco Prismatama - the operator of the Indomaret retail network - for an IPO on the IDX. However, Haliman asserted that the Indomaret IPO plan will not materialize in 2025. Haliman explained that they are still carefully considering Indomaret's financial condition before proceeding with the IPO.

marketNews.title: Correction Regarding Share Acquisition in Sumber Sinergi Makmur (IOTF)
marketNews.content: In Snips on Tuesday (24/6) published at 19:30 WIB, there was an error in writing the name of the company conducting a share increase in Sumber Sinergi Makmur or "IOTF". The company that correctly conducted the acquisition was PT Gaia Artha Dinamic or "GAIA", not PT Garuda Indonesia Tbk or "GIAA". This has been corrected at 21:30 WIB on the same day. We apologize for any confusion this may have caused.

tickerNews.title: Hartono Brothers Entity Acquires 3.64% Stake in HEAL at a Premium Price
tickerNews.content: Medikaloka Hermina (HEAL) announced that PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan has acquired ~559.2 million treasury shares of the company at a price of 1,875 rupiah per share, which is approximately +36.4% higher than HEAL's stock price on Wednesday (25/6). The number of treasury shares is equivalent to a 3.64% ownership portion, and after this transaction, HEAL holds no treasury shares. PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan is owned by the Hartono brothers, namely Robert Budi Hartono and Michael Bambang Hartono, where the company is also a shareholder of Sarana Menara Nusantara (TOWR) and the controller of Bank Central Asia (BBCA).

tickerNews.title: Gudang Garam (GGRM) Shareholders Approve Dividend Distribution for 2024 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: Investor Daily reported that Gudang Garam (GGRM) shareholders on Wednesday (25/6) approved the plan to distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 962 billion rupiah or 500 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a 98% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 0%) and indicates a dividend yield of 5.6% as of Wednesday (25/6). The cum date and payment date have not yet been announced.

tickerNews.title: Bangun Kosambi Sukses (CBDK) Plans Share Buyback Up to 1 Trillion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Bangun Kosambi Sukses (CBDK) plans to conduct a share buyback with an allocation of funds up to 1 trillion rupiah in the period of June 25-September 24, 2025. The company did not specify the number of shares to be bought back in this corporate action. This plan does not require GMS approval, following the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability. Previously, CBDK announced a buyback plan in March 2025, but there has been no change in the number of outstanding shares from February 2025 until the end of May 2025.

tickerNews.title: Total Bangun Persada (TOTL) Secures New Contract Value of IDR 2.17 Trillion Until May 2025
tickerNews.content: The Corporate Secretary of Total Bangun Persada (TOTL), Anggie S. Sidharta, told Kontan that the company recorded a new contract value of 2.17 trillion rupiah during 5M25 (+17.3% YoY), equivalent to 43.4% of the 2025 target of 5 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Lo Kheng Hong Holds 5.02% Stake in Salim Ivomas Pratama (SIMP)
tickerNews.content: Lo Kheng Hong is recorded to hold ~778.86 million (5.02%) shares of Salim Ivomas Pratama (SIMP), based on KSEI data as of June 24, 2025. The transaction value is unknown. Previously, Lo Kheng Hong did not appear in the list of SIMP shareholders with ownership exceeding 5%.

tickerNews.title: Bekasi Fajar Industrial Estate (BEST) Targets Marketing Sales of IDR 600 Billion in 2025
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Bekasi Fajar Industrial Estate (BEST), Leo Yulianto Sutedja, stated that the company targets land marketing sales of 600 billion rupiah during 2025, up +48.1% YoY compared to the 2024 realization of 405 billion rupiah. Leo also mentioned that BEST targets stable recurring income growth, where the warehousing and logistics, consumer goods, food and beverage (F&B), and data center sectors are the main targets for land development and sales marketing, especially in the MM2100 Industrial Estate in Bekasi, West Java.

tickerNews.title: Buyung Poetra Sembada (HOKI) Targets 10% Sales Growth in 2025
tickerNews.content: Kontan reports that Buyung Poetra Sembada (HOKI) targets at least +10% YoY sales growth during 2025, in line with the national distribution expansion strategy and the launch of new high value-added products through the 'Daily Meal' line. HOKI Director, Budiman Susilo, also mentioned that the company is preparing a new 15 billion rupiah factory for 'Daily Meal' rice production in Boyolali, Central Java, with a production target starting in September or October 2025.
